actionGroup.explanation: Un-Installation for Patch install: Altibase entity provider

setInstallerVariableFromScriptOutput.name: AltibaseProviderRemove
setInstallerVariableFromScriptOutput.progressText: Un-Installation(prev. version) for Patch Install : Altibase entity provider

writeFile.text:
:: ::DB Creation code. ::
set ADMIN="${installdir}\bin\isql.exe" -u sys -p manager -sysdba -noprompt
echo startup process; | %ADMIN% echo. echo create database ${altibase_user_dbname} INITSIZE=${init_db_size} ${archivelog_values} character set ${db_char_set} national character set ${national_char_set}; | %ADMIN%
server kill;

* Grant the 'Log on as a Service' permission to the user that was used to install ALTIBASE HDB 1. Launch the Group Policy Editor ("Start --> Run --> type 'gpedit.msc' ") 2. In the left pane, expand "Computer Configuration --> Windows Settings --> Security Settings --> Local Policies", and then click "User Rights Assignment". 3. In the right pane, double-click "Log on as a service". 4. Confirm that the user account you are using is in the list. If this account is not listed here, add the user to the policy, and then click "OK". 5. Close the "Local Security Settings" dialog.
* Provide the correct user ID and password for the ALTIBASE HDB service If no password has been specified for this account, the ALTIBASE HDB service will not start.
1. Open the "Services" MMC Snap-in (services.msc command) 2. Double-click on the ALTIBASE HDB service. 3. Select the 'Log On' tab. Select the desired user account and enter the correct password for that account.
* Register a license Rename and locate your license file as shown below. ${installdir}\conf\license
If a license has not been issued, or if it has expired, ALTIBASE HDB services will not start.
If this is the case, please visit http://support.altibase.com
* Creating a database 1. Create a database automatically. If the post_install.bat database creation script was generated during installation, a database will be created when this script is executed. (post_install.bat: ${installdir}\install\post_install.bat)
2. Create a database manually. If a database creation script has not been created, a database must be created manually using the following command prior to starting the server.
server create [DB Character-set] [National Character-set]
* Startup/Shutdown server shell> server start shell> server stop
* Connect to the database using iSQL shell> isql -s 127.0.0.1 -u SYS -p MANAGER

Warning :
This is a special diagnostic package intended only for use in tracking problems or for other special purposes.
Because this package is not officially supported, do not use it for extended periods or in production environments.

directoryParameter.name: installdir
directoryParameter.explanation: Please specify the installation directory for ALTIBASE HDB Server ${altibase_base_version}.${altibase_tagset_version}.${altibase_tag_version}

showWarning.text:
The ALTIBASE HDB ${altibase_base_version} server has already been installed for use by all users of this computer.
At this time, it is only possible to patch the existing installation.
In order to perform a full ALTIBASE HDB installation, it is first necessary to uninstall the previously installed ALTIBASE HDB ${altibase_base_version} server.

The ALTIBASE HDB Server package cannot be installed in ${installdir} because a previous version is already installed in the same location.
Please uninstall the previous version of ALTIBASE HDB Server and try again.

Some files from a previous ALTIBASE HDB installation were found. (property files, log files, data files, etc.)
Before ALTIBASE HDB can be installed, it is necessary to remove all ALTIBASE HDB files remaining from the previous installations. (Be sure to back them up if required.)
The ALTIBASE HDB patch upgrade wizard cannot proceed, because ALTIBASE HDB is not installed. Please install ALTIBASE HDB before attempting to upgrade it.

infoParameter.name: start_checklist
infoParameter.title: CHECKLIST: Please be sure to check the following before installation${altibase_dist_type}
infoParameter.value:
CHECKLIST: Please be sure to check the following before installation:
When installing Altibase DBMS products for Windows using the ALTIBASE HDB Package Installer, it is necessary to be logged on to Windows as an administrator. The ALTIBASE HDB Package Installer registers the ALTIBASE HDB ODBC driver, registers the ALTIBASE HDB server as a Windows service, and starts the service during the ALTIBASE HDB server installation process. Only administrators can register the ODBC driver, register the process as a Windows service, and start the service.
[ Windows User Permissions ]
On Windows Vista and Windows 7, it is somewhat difficult to create a database and register ALTIBASE HDB as a service due to the enhanced security features. In order to avoid these problems, it is recommended that the User Account Control (UAC) settings be changed before installation as follows: (For detailed information about UAC, please refer to http://support.microsoft.com/kb/922708/en-us.)
1. Open "Control Panel\User Accounts\Change User Account Control settings". 2. Disable notification by dragging the slider all the way down to the bottom ("Never notify"). 3. Restart Windows (Vista or 7). 4. Run the ALTIBASE HDB Package Installer.
If you did not create a database or register ALTIBASE HDB as a service during installation, a UAC prompt may appear when performing these tasks after installation. To prevent this prompt from appearing during such tasks, follow these steps:
1. Right-click the "Database Creation" and "Service Registration" executable files (or icons), and then click "Run as administrator". (Note: If using the command prompt to execute the files, the command prompt window must be launched with the "Run as administrator" option.) 2. When you are prompted for an administrator password or for confirmation, type the administrator password or click "Continue".
[ Granting the 'Log on as a Service' permission for the ALTIBASE HDB Windows service ]
Before starting the ALTIBASE HDB Windows service, the following settings must be made:
* Grant the 'Log on as a Service' permission 1. Launch the Group Policy Editor ("Start --> Run --> type 'gpedit.msc' ") 2. In the left pane, expand "Computer Configuration --> Windows Settings --> Security Settings --> Local Policies", and then click "User Rights Assignment". 3. In the right pane, double-click "Log on as a service". 4. Confirm that the user account that you are using is in the list. If this account is not listed here, add the user to the policy, and then click "OK". 5. Close the "Local Security Settings" dialog.
[ Correct User ID and Password ]
* Provide the correct user ID and password for the ALTIBASE HDB service If no password has been specified for this account, the ALTIBASE HDB service will not start.
1. Open the "Services" MMC Snap-in (services.msc command) 2. Double-click on the ALTIBASE HDB service. 3. Select the 'Log On' tab. Select the desired user account and enter the correct password for that account.

parameterGroup.name: Property2
parameterGroup.title: ALTIBASE HDB Property Settings Step 2: Database Creation Properties${altibase_dist_type}

parameterGroup.name: Property3
parameterGroup.title: ALTIBASE HDB Property Settings Step 3: Set Database Directories${altibase_dist_type}

directoryParameter.name: loganchor_dir1
directoryParameter.explanation: [Log Anchor File Directories ] ALTIBASE HDB maintains three sets of log anchor files. These files contain important information about the database. By default, they are located in the "logs" folder. The location can be changed here or by modifying the contents of the ALTIBASE HDB properties file, which is named "altibase.properties".

infoParameter.name: property_report
infoParameter.title: Property Review${altibase_dist_type}
infoParameter.value:
To change these properties after installation is complete, please modify the following file: ${installdir}\conf\altibase.properties.
1. ALTIBASE HDB Property Settings: Step 1: Basic Database Operation Properties
1) Database name: [${altibase_user_dbname}]
2) ALTIBASE HDB connection port number (1024-65535): [${altibase_server_port_no}]
3) Maximum size of memory database: [${mem_max_db_size}]
4) Buffer area size for caching disk-based database pages: [${buffer_area_size}]
2. ALTIBASE HDB Property Settings: Step 2: Database Creation Properties
${property2_result}
3. ALTIBASE HDB Property Settings: Step 3: Set Database Directories
The database will not operate properly if any of these directories are removed.
1) Disk database directory: [${default_disk_db_dir}]
2) Memory database directory: [${mem_db_dir}]
3) Archive log directory: [${archive_dir}]
4) Transaction log directory: [${log_dir}]
5) Log Anchor file directories: Directory 1: [${loganchor_dir1}]
Directory 2: [${loganchor_dir2}]
Directory 3: [${loganchor_dir3}]

setInstallerVariable.name: property2_result
setInstallerVariable.value:
1) Initial database size [${init_db_size}]
2) Database archive logging mode [${archivelog_values}]
3) Database character set [${db_char_set}]
4) National character set [${national_char_set}]

choiceParameter.name: install_scope
choiceParameter.title: Installation scope
choiceParameter.explanation: Do you want to install ALTIBASE HDB for the current user, or for all users of this computer?

labelParameter.name: empty_space
labelParameter.explanation: Note: This setting governs the creation of environment variables, registry entries, and start menu shortcuts. If you select "All Users", the installer will create system-level environment variables, registry entries, and shortcuts, whereas if you select "The Current User", the installer will create user-level environment variables, registry entries, and shortcuts for the current user only.

choiceParameter.name: odbc_setup
choiceParameter.title: ODBC Setup${altibase_dist_type}
choiceParameter.explanation: Do you want to install the ALTIBASE HDB ODBC driver? The ODBC driver will be available for use by all users, even if you install ALTIBASE HDB only for the current user.

showQuestion.text: The ALTIBASE HDB ODBC driver has already been installed. Would you like to overwrite the previously installed driver?

parameterGroup.name: altibase_select_edition
parameterGroup.title: ALTIBASE HDB Edition
parameterGroup.explanation: Community Edition provides the same functions, features and tools as Enterprise Edition, but has data size limitations of 4GB in-memory and 8GB on disk. Upgrade to Enterprise Edition to get unlimited data storage and premium support.

infoParameter.name: altibase_set_guide_in
infoParameter.title: ALTIBASE HDB Quick Setting Guide
infoParameter.value:
[ Installation complete ] Please refer to the following file to check the version of ALTIBASE HDB. ${patch_dir}\patchinfo
[ Quick Guide to Making Settings in ALTIBASE HDB] Two steps are required before ALTIBASE HDB services can be started.
* Register a license. * Create a database -------------------------------
* Register a license Rename and locate your license file as shown below. ${installdir}\conf\license
If a license has not been issued, or if it has expired, ALTIBASE HDB services will not start.
If this is the case, please visit http://support.altibase.com
* Creating a database 1. Create a database automatically. If a database creation script was generated during installation, a database will be created when post_install.bat is executed. (post_install.bat: ${installdir}\install\post_install.bat)
2. Creat a database manually. If a database creation script has not been created, a database must be created manually using the following command prior to starting services.
server create [DB Character-set] [National Character-set]
* Startup/Shutdown server shell> server start shell> server stop
* Connect to database using iSQL shell> isql -s 127.0.0.1 -u SYS -p MANAGER

booleanParameter.name: service_question_in
booleanParameter.description: Would you like to register ALTIBASE HDB as a Windows service now?

showInfo.text:
It is necessary for the "Log on as a service" privilege to have been granted to the user that was used to install ALTIBASE HDB.
If the "Log on as a service" privilege has not been granted to this user, the ALTIBASE HDB Windows service cannot be started.
Please follow the steps below to grant the "Log on as a service" privilege to the user.
1) Open the "Local Security Policy Manager" Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in (Start -> program or file search -> secpol.msc) 2) Select "Security Settings" 3) Select "Local Policies" 4) Select "User Rights Allocation" 5) Open the "Log on as a service" policy and add the user

infoParameter.name: service_warnnig
infoParameter.value:
The "Log on as a service" privilege must have been granted to the user that was used to install ALTIBASE HDB.
Before registering the ALTIBASE HDB server as a Windows service, please make sure that the following settings have been properly made.
* Grant the 'Log on as a Service' permission 1. Launch the Group Policy Editor ("Start --> Run --> type 'gpedit.msc' ") 2. In the left pane, expand "Computer Configuration --> Windows Settings --> Security Settings --> Local Policies", and then click "User Rights Assignment". 3. In the right pane, double-click "Log on as a service". 4. Confirm that the user account that you are using is in the list. If this account is not listed here, add the user to the policy, and then click "OK". 5. Close the "Local Security Settings" dialog.
* Provide the correct User ID and Password for the ALTIBASE HDB service. If no password has been specified for this account, the ALTIBASE HDB service will not start.
1. Open the "Services" MMC Snap-in (services.msc command) 2. Double-click on the ALTIBASE_651_SERVICE service. 3. Select the 'Log On' tab. Select the desired user account and enter the correct password for that account.
* Register a license. Rename and locate your license file as shown below. ${installdir}\conf\license
* Creating a database 1. Create a database automatically. If a database creation script was generated during installation, a database will be created when post_install.bat is executed. (post_install.bat: ${installdir}\install\post_install.bat)
2. Create a database manually. If a database creation script has not been created, a database must be created manually using the following command prior to starting services.
server create [DB Character-set] [National Character-set]
* Startup/Shutdown server shell> server start shell> server stop
* Connect to the database using iSQL shell> isql -s 127.0.0.1 -u SYS -p MANAGER

createWindowsService.description: This service activates the Altibase HDB agent

showWarning.text:
Unable to add ALTIBASE HDB as a Windows service.
Please check the user account settings and Service name.

showInfo.text: ALTIBASE HDB was successfully registered as a Windows service.
The ALTIBASE HDB Windows service is now running.

showWarning.text:
ALTIBASE HDB was successfully registered as a Windows service but the ALTIBASE HDB service failed to start.
Before ALTIBASE HDB can be started as a Windows service, the following settings must be made:
1) Open the "Log on as a service" policy and add the user that was used to install ALTIBASE HDB 1-1. Open the "Local Security Settings" (secpol.msc command) Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in. 1-2. Select "Security Settings" 1-3. Select "Local Policies" 1-4. Select "User Rights Management" 1-5. Open the "Log on as a service" policy and add the user
2) A valid Windows user ID and password must be provided for ALTIBASE HDB service 2-1. Open the "Services" (services.msc command) 2-2. Open the ALTIBASE HDB service. 2-3. Select the 'Log On' tab. Enter a valid password.
3) A valid ALTIBASE HDB license must exist If a license has not been issued, or if it has expired, ALTIBASE HDB services will not start.
If this is the case, Please visit http://support.altibase.com
4) A database must be created If a database creation script has already been created at ${installdir}\install\post_install.bat, running this script will create a database.
If a database creation script has not been created, a database must be created manually using the following command prior to starting the service.
server create [DB Character-set] [National Character-set]
